newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: Macraes half yr net profit NZ$3.9 mln.
newsitem.headline: Macraes half yr net profit NZ$3.9 mln.

text.p: Macraes Mining Co Ltd said on Wednesday that its half year result, due in a few days, would show a net profit of NZ$3.9 million and cash on hand of $25.7 million.

The gold miner confirmed deferral of a major expansion which would result in annual savings of $19 million because of reduced outlays on exploration, administration, operations and capital expenditure.
Some 66 jobs would be cut at the mine site near Dunedin, the project office at Reefton and at the company's headquarters in Perth.
Macraes said the fall in the price of gold and delays in gaining all necessary local government approvals were blamed for the postponed expansion.

Projected expansion to 300,000 ounces a year "remains an objective of the company" despite the decision, managing director Patrick O'Connor said, together with investment in a recovery enhancement project to boost long-term gold recovery.
Exploration outlays would be reduced by $12 million, administration costs by $3 million and operations and capital expenditure by $4 million, Macraes said.
A review of the carrying value of capitalised expenditure would be conducted in the current six months.
The company also issued a revised forecast for its full-year gold production, which it said would total 120,000 ounces at a cash cost of NZ$490 an ounce.
In the June quarter its gold production totalled 32,130 ounces at a cash cost of $487, and a gross operating margin of $238 an ounce.
Macraes said it had hedging available for 773,302 ounces of gold which had a net surplus value compared to market value of $66.87 million.
